page.title: 12A CARAVAN PARK.
page.content: {CONWY COUNCIL CARAVAN PARK It was opened in 1949 for tents only, later it was capable of holding 750 stationary & 250 touring caravans and 150 tents. About 4000 people visit the 37 acre site yearly between April and Sept.The warden works all week,13 hrs. a day and has 12 assistants.The toilets are cleaned 8 times a day there's a laundry room and some shops on the site.A safe beach is near by and pets are allowed. There is a playing area for Children but no swings or roundabouts. This site is closing down.The new road will emerge from a tunnel soon to be built under the Conway River and sweep through the caravan site.This is only one change the new road will make to our area.
